definition: to be embarrassingly short of money
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: QinQiong clemson is already in debt for seven days of the rent money not to.
sentences.chinese: 秦琼囊中羞涩，已经欠了七天的房租钱未给。

sentences.english: They are poor; they love money and getting a paycheck.
sentences.chinese: 他们囊中羞涩，因此喜欢钱，喜欢领薪水。

sentences.english: People who always had very little now have nothing.
sentences.chinese: 本来就囊中羞涩的人们如今一无所有。

sentences.english: In the belly hungry, but poorer path bite gold think out money fast trick.
sentences.chinese: 肚中饥饿，但囊中羞涩的程咬金想出来钱快的鬼点子。

sentences.english: This restaurant catered to large appetites and modest purses.
sentences.chinese: 这家饭馆向胃口很大但囊中羞涩的人供餐。

sentences.english: The budget buffet attracted customers with immoderate appetites but limited pocket books.
sentences.chinese: 廉价的自助餐吸引了胃口大但囊中羞涩的顾客们。

sentences.english: But all also suffer from cystic in Xiuse, often embarrassing for the poor worry about.
sentences.chinese: 但这一切又苦于囊中羞涩，时常为此尴尬穷愁。

sentences.english: What is the best advice you can offer other entrepreneurs who don't have much means?
sentences.chinese: 你为那些囊中羞涩的企业家提供的最佳建议是什么？

definition: to economize on clothes and food/to scrimp and save (idiom)
hard pressed for money/in financial straits
to save on food and clothing (idiom); to live frugally
to possess nothing except bare necessities/to live a poor or frugal life
poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly
lit. stake a thousand pieces of gold on one throw (idiom); to throw away money recklessly/extravagant
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: poor and with low expectations/poverty stunts ambition
to live frugally/to economize on food and clothing/to scrimp and save
